p.s: Throughthrough the news I discovered the fact that The Hate U Give is banned from school libraries in Texas.
The book is supposed to be vulgar, uses offensive language and contains scenes not appropriate for young people.
I think even though it is a book worth reading.
It describes scenes very well and you get a closer look on what effect racism has on the people and how they struggle to deal with it.
Racism is a major problem in the USA and that also comes from the lack of education and information about it.
Furthermore, the accusations are not wrong but stressed out a little.
The language is stronger than formal English, but that is how the characters and the people speak and it makes it more realistic.
The point that it depicts drug use is true, but the background of it is different.
It does not say that drugs are a good thing.
It is a topic but it explains how the drug use is destroying their society in some way.
So it does not support taking our selling drugs, it just says what the problem is and where it comes from.

The police is not shown as something negative in particular, but they underline the juristic problem and makes the reader think twice and dig deeper when a police officer is not charged for killing people they stop and search.
That is why I think it is a good way to bring students the topic of racism closer and can create a view on it, that maybe was not possible before.
I would be glad if you would consider reading it in your school too or make it be accessible in your school library.
